ezrlc.View

Class JEngineerField

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JTextField
              • ezrlc.View.JEngineerField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class JEngineerField
extends javax.swing.JTextField
implements java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener
    A powerful JTextField with inputverifyer, multiple outputmodes, rangecontroll and a few static methods to work with doubles.
    Since:
    30.05.2014
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Richard Gut, FHNW, Patrick Studer, FHNW
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

        col - Number of columns.

      • JEngineerField

        public JEngineerField(int digits,
                      int col)
        Constructs a JEngineerField (outputmode = ENG)
        Parameters:
        digits - Number of digits (e.g. 12.34e-12 = 4 digits)
        col - Number of columns.

      • JEngineerField

        public JEngineerField(int digits,
                      int col,
                      int outputmode)
        onstructs a JEngineerField
        Parameters:
        digits - Anzahl angezeigter Digits (ENG und UNIT) oder Anzahl Nachkommastellen (FLOAT)
        digits - Number of digits (e.g. 12.34e-12 = 4 digits)
        col - Number of columns.
        outputmode - Defines the output mode. (e.g. UNIT = 123.4k, ENG = 123.4e3)

    • Method Detail

      • DoubletoStringENG

        public static java.lang.String DoubletoStringENG(double val,
                                                 int digits,
                                                 int outputmode)
        Converts a double value to a formatted String.
        Parameters:
        val - The value that you want to convert.
        digits - Number of digits (e.g. 12.34e-12 = 4 digits)
        outputmode - Defines the output mode. (e.g. UNIT = 123.4k, ENG = 123.4e3)
        Returns:
        The formatted number as a String.

      • getExpOfValue

        public static int getExpOfValue(double val)
        Returns the exponent of a number.
        Parameters:
        val - A value.
        Returns:
        The value's exponent.

      • getUnitOfValue

        public static java.lang.String getUnitOfValue(double val)
        Returns the exponent of a number and converts it to unit suffix.
        Parameters:
        val - A value.
        Returns:
        The value's unit suffix. (from 1e-15 to 1e15)
